definition:
A [*semigroup*]{} $G$ is a set together with a binary operation
$\cdot: G \times G \longrightarrow G$ which satisfies the associative
property: $(a \cdot b) \cdot c = a \cdot (b \cdot c)$ for all
$a,b,c \in G$.

The set $G$ is not required to be nonempty.

Let $G,H$ be two semigroups. A *semigroup homomorphism* from $G$ to $H$
is a function $f:G\to H$ such that $f(ab)=f(a)f(b)$.
